meanings.definition: The act or process of reducing or lessening something.
meanings.sent1: The abatement of noise pollution in the city made it a more peaceful place to live.
meanings.sent2: The construction work had to pause for the abatement of asbestos removal.
meanings.sent3: The abatement of my little brother's tantrum was achieved by giving him his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as an abatement to the storm of emotions raging within him.
meanings.sent5: The abatement of the sun's harsh rays behind the clouds brought relief to the hikers.

meanings.definition: A temporary halt or suspension of an ongoing activity.
meanings.sent1: The abatement of the soccer game due to heavy rain disappointed the players.
meanings.sent2: The abatement of the factory's production line was necessary for maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The sudden abatement of the music at the party left everyone in silence.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was a welcome abatement to the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The abatement of the traffic flow caused a delay in reaching the destination.

meanings.definition: A decrease in the intensity or severity of something.
meanings.sent1: The abatement of the fever brought relief to the sick child.
meanings.sent2: The abatement of the storm's fury allowed people to go outside again.
meanings.sent3: The abatement of the teacher's strictness made the students happy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an abatement to the gloominess of the room.
meanings.sent5: The abatement of the pain in his knee made him able to walk comfortably again.
